neighbors.name: Lloyd S. Fultz Jr. & Dawn E. Fultz
neighbors.claims: Lloyd S. Fultz Jr. is a resident of Old Fields in Hardy County ([Moorefield Examiner](https://moorefieldexaminer.com/2024/12/04/letter-to-the-editor-6/)). He has been publicly outspoken regarding local industrial agriculture impacts, specifically writing a letter to the editor arguing that Pilgrim’s Pride is a major local polluter and should be assessed fees to fund emergency services ([Moorefield Examiner](https://moorefieldexaminer.com/2024/12/04/letter-to-the-editor-6/)). He also spoke at a July 2020 Hardy County Commission meeting regarding a poultry 'mega' house project, stating that approved projects 'take no consideration of the impacts on us' and expressing concern about workers and environmental degradation ([Moorefield Examiner](https://moorefieldexaminer.s3.amazonaws.com/Moorefield+Examiner+7-1-20.pdf)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage regarding environmental safeguards and potential revenue benefits for emergency services, addressing his specific history of advocacy for corporate accountability and pollution control.

citations.claim: Resident of Old Fields; wrote LTE regarding Pilgrim's Pride fees and pollution
citations.title: Letter to the Editor: Pilgrim's Pride

citations.claim: Spoke at County Commission meeting opposing poultry project impacts
citations.title: Commission lays levy; hears from public on poultry project

neighbors.name: George Robert Shockey, Maude E. Shockey & Robert Shockey
neighbors.claims: George R. Shockey was born in Old Fields, WV in 1946 and lived there his entire life, passing away in November 2024 at age 78 ([Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/george-shockey)). He is survived by his wife, Maude “Sis” Shockey, and their son, Robert Shockey, who resides in Pennsylvania ([Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/george-shockey)). George was known for his passion for the outdoors, hunting, and fishing ([Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/george-shockey)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected community member reach out with respect for the Shockey family’s long local legacy and condolences regarding the recent passing of George.

citations.claim: George R. Shockey obituary details and survivors
citations.title: Obituary: George Robert Shockey

neighbors.name: Cary Joe Turner & Jennifer Turner
neighbors.claims: Jennifer Turner serves as Vice President at Grant County Bank and is a Board Member of the Hardy County Chamber of Commerce ([Hardy County Chamber](https://www.hardycountychamber.org/about)). Cary Joe Turner is a resident of Old Fields and son of the late Lysle Glenn Turner ([Giffin Funeral Home](https://www.giffinfuneralhome.com/obituaries/Lysle-G-Turner?obId=2491718)). Jennifer and Joe Turner attended a Hardy County Planning Commission meeting in September 2020 regarding a controversial poultry CAFO project, indicating engagement with local land-use issues ([Hardy County](http://www.hardycounty.com/files/documents/41406a02-4bb9-4f59-a61e-7fa82d700043.pdf)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach professionally acknowledging Jennifer's role in the local business community (Chamber/Bank); focus on economic benefits and orderly development.

citations.claim: Jennifer Turner is VP at Grant County Bank and Chamber Board Member
citations.title: Hardy County Chamber of Commerce: About Us

citations.claim: Attended Planning Commission meeting regarding poultry CAFO
citations.title: Hardy County Planning Commission Minutes

neighbors.name: David Stephens & Shari Stephens
neighbors.claims: Shari Stephens is the Director of the Hardy County Family Support Center ([WV Bureau for Family Assistance](https://bfa.wv.gov/media/19456/download?inline)). She is a vocal advocate for social services in the region, frequently quoted in local media regarding the housing crisis, homelessness, and food insecurity in Hardy County ([Mountain State Spotlight](https://mountainstatespotlight.org/2025/04/01/affordable-housing-lawmakers-session/)). In interviews, she has highlighted the lack of affordable housing and shelters in the county ([Mountain State Spotlight](https://mountainstatespotlight.org/2024/10/16/voter-election-2024-potomac-highlands/)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Shari with a focus on community benefits, specifically how the project might support the local tax base or social services, given her professional focus on housing and family support.

citations.claim: Shari Stephens is Director of Hardy County Family Support Center
citations.title: 2025-2026 Family Support Center Directory

citations.claim: Quoted regarding housing crisis and homelessness
citations.title: As lawmakers debate affordable housing, West Virginians struggle to find homes

citations.claim: Discussed homelessness and lack of shelters
citations.title: Voters in the Potomac Highlands want better jobs and housing
